item.description:
This will be a winter hike of about 2-3 hours through the Goodwin forest trail system. It will be weather dependent (if it's snowing really hard or if it's raining, I'll reschedule it -- Light snow/snow on the ground, we'll be going). You definitely will want warm, waterproof hiking boots and to dress in layers. I will bring a thermos flask of hot tea and some energy snacks. Dogs are welcome, but let me know if you're going to bring one, please.

We will meet at the Pine Acres recreation area parking lot on Potter Road opposite the Conservation Education Center. Map of the area is here: http://www.ct.gov/dep...

Please be on time, because we will leave the parking area for the trail at 1pm.
item.how_to_find_us: We will gather by the picnic table opposite the conservation center/museum

group.name: The NorthEast Connecticut Friends Meetup Group

item.name: Winter Solstice Hike
